meanings.definition: To outwit or outmaneuver in a military strategy.
meanings.sent1: The general was able to outgeneraling the enemy by using clever tactics.
meanings.sent2: The army succeeded in outgeneraling their opponents by planning their moves carefully.
meanings.sent3: The soldiers joked that they were outgeneraling the other side by playing chess during breaks.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a master strategist, outgeneraling her opponents at every turn.
meanings.sent5: The idea of outgeneraling the enemy became a thrilling challenge for the young cadets.

meanings.definition: To surpass in strategic planning or tactics.
meanings.sent1: By carefully analyzing the situation, he managed to outgeneraling his competitors.
meanings.sent2: The team's ability to outgeneraling their rivals led them to victory.
meanings.sent3: The students were outgeneraling each other in a friendly competition of strategy games.
meanings.sent4: Her knack for outgeneraling others made her a sought-after consultant.
meanings.sent5: The art of outgeneraling opponents was a skill he honed through years of practice.
